bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alberto Recio, July 11, 1941

div1.p: Hench inquires if Recio will help him locate a copy of "Memoria del Hospital Numero Uno Correspondiente al ano de 1902." He would like to give a copy to the Surgeon General's Library.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alberto Recio, July 11, 1941
div1.p:
6/30/41 Dr. Alberto Recio
Director de Sanidad
Secretaria de Sanidad y Beneficencia
Republica de Cuba
Habana, Cuba
My dear Dr Recio

I hope you are receiving the Proceedings of the Mayo
clinic Staff meetings which I promised to have sent to you
with my compliments. Last April you and Dr Ramos were
kind enough to introduce me to the librarian at the
Finlay Institute. I was anxious to find something about
the history of Military Hospital number one where some of
the early work (especially that by Agramonte) of the United
States Army Yellow Fever Board was done in 1900.
We I had been unable to find anything on it about
that hospital in various libraries in this country.
The librarian at the Finlay Institute showed me a
copy of "Memoria del Hospital Numero Uno
Correspondiente al ano de 1902. Presentada a la
Junta de Patronos por el Medico Director Dr,
Alfredo Valdes Galliol, Habana - Imrrenta
Mercantil Teniente Rey Numero 12, 1903
(46 pages & plates). Republica de Cuba, Departmento
de Beneficencia.

I have been trying unsuccessfully to locate a copy
of that booklet in the United States libraries.
Do you believe that a copy might be still available
for me from your department de Beneficencia?
I thought there might be still an extra copy
somewhere in your department and I would be so
grateful to receive it. If this is not possible I
AC
PR
am writing the librarian at the Finlay Institute to see
if he can lend me his copy so that I can have
photostatic copies made. It would cost me considerable
to have this done in Cuba, I believe, but I could have
a copy made here at no cost to myself. Furthermore I
could have a copy made for the Surgeon-General's
Library in Washington.

I am continuing my efforts in behalf of the
memorializing of Camp Lazear & the little Building
Number One. When I was in Havana you told me you
planned to have an accurate survey made of
the present site of Camp Lazear Have you been
able to have that done? I should be so
interested to hear.
